dialogues.text: (shakes head) Pool guy. Or concert security. With the yellow jacket. And the metal detector stick. ‘Kid, gotta ask you to open that backpack!’

dialogues.speaker: WICHITA
dialogues.text: Now we'll never know. (shrugs) Maybe we're underestimating him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FLASHBACK of the pre-Zombieland ALBUQUERQUE working his most recent JOB. He’s not taping ankles. He’s on a STREET SPINNING one of those BIG CARDBOARD REAL ESTATE ARROW SIG Albuquerque’s a DISASTER. The sign keeps DROPPING. WHACKI him in the face. LAUNCHING off his finger into traffic. A DRIVER of a CONVERTIBLE gets NAILED in the head and SWERV

dialogues.speaker: STILLWATER
dialogues.text: Nah.

dialogues.speaker: WICHITA
dialogues.text: And the skinny one?  56.

dialogues.speaker: STILLWATER
dialogues.text: (rolls eyes) Get some sun!

dialogues.speaker: WICHITA
dialogues.text: He kinda screamed... Kinko's.

dialogues.speaker: STILLWATER
dialogues.text: Something geeky...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLAGSTAFF is wearing a BLUE ‘BEST BUY’ SHIRT, playing VIR TENNIS on a NINTENDO WII in the video game department, tr hard to impress a hot FEMALE CUSTOMER. He SWINGS the controller back to hit a forehand and WIPES OUT an entire DISPLAY CASE.

dialogues.speaker: STILLWATER
dialogues.text: Amazing.

dialogues.speaker: WICHITA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: STILLWATER
dialogues.text: How they got this far. Made it way out here. They should be proud.

dialogues.speaker: WICHITA
dialogues.text: They can die happy. (realizes her ominous word choice) I mean... Stillwater hears this and steals a few glances at the vas burning, empty desert... as far as the eye can see. Wichi keeps looking determinedly ahead down the road. Stillwater’s last glance is over her shoulder. Then she looks over at Wichita, who slowly returns the stare.

dialogues.speaker: WICHITA
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: WICHITA
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: WICHITA
dialogues.text: We're not going back! They’re dangerous!

dialogues.speaker: STILLWATER
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: WICHITA
dialogues.text: O.K., not dangerous. Pathetic. But what did we say?

dialogues.speaker: STILLWATER
dialogues.text: Just you and me.

dialogues.speaker: WICHITA
dialogues.text: You and me. Even if it means leaving behind the slow or the weak.

dialogues.speaker: STILLWATER
dialogues.text: Or one slow. And one weak.

dialogues.speaker: WICHITA
dialogues.text: Right. A couple beats.

dialogues.speaker: STILLWATER
dialogues.text: I saw this Discovery Channel show. On wildebeest herds. They always wait for the slow and the weak. That way, when the lions show up... they only eat the slow and the weak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wichita, who had turned back to the road, slowly turns ba to look at Stillwater again. They share a sly look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the HUMMER from behind. Its BRAKE LIGHTS come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hummer is now FULL. WICHITA is driving. ALBUQUERQUE sits in the passenger seat.  58. STILLWATER is sitting ‘bitch’ (backseat middle), aiming h SAWED-OFF SHOTGUN at FLAGSTAFF, who sits beside her to he left, looking GIDDY.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: That face? That's me realizing... A) I just got picked up by the girl of my dreams... B) She can’t use the ‘boyfriend’ shield... and C) My lone competition's only life goal is eating a sponge cake with creamy filling. Superimposed Onscreen: 3 TITLES, displayed consecutively Flagstaff talks about them: A) Picked up by Girl of Dreams B) ‘Boyfriend’ Excuse Out of Date C) Competition Weak

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Thanks, guys. You have really big hearts. ALBUQUERQUE’s knees are nearly up to his chest.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: And really short legs. Albuquerque hits the electric seat lever, moving the seat BACKWARD.

dialogues.speaker: STILLWATER
dialogues.text: Make one more adjustment to my seat, and you're riding ‘Bitch.’ STILLWATER shifts her shotgun from Flagstaff to the back Albuquerque’s head. Albuquerque turns and flinches slight at the sight of the barrel.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Last time I call ‘Shotgun!’ Albuquerque makes a little face at Stillwater, then rebelliously TWEAKS his HEADREST.

dialogues.speaker: SMASH CUT TO
dialogues.text: ALBUQUERQUE, now sitting ‘BITCH’ in the BACKSEAT with Stillwater. FLAGSTAFF is now riding up front, equally uncomfortable with the seat position of an 1l-year-old gi  59.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: He’s got a point.

dialogues.speaker: STILLWATER
dialogues.text: It’s like an 8-position seat! It took me forever to find the perfect spot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STILLWATER is perched in the passenger seat, ADJUSTING it with the levers. Up. Down. Backwards. Forwards. Back down. Up again. Desperately struggling to find a comfortable position. She seems to get cozy. Then makes o more adjustment.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: You must be exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: STILLWATER
dialogues.text: Kinda. Yeah. Awkward silence. At last, FLAGSTAFF looks for an opening, anything to engage WICHITA.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Keep it under 75 and you can eke out a few extra miles a gallon.

dialogues.speaker: WICHITA
dialogues.text: Not so worried about global warming, Tipper. Apocalypse and all. Flagstaff stares... this girl is a spitfire!

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Oh, and D) Cupid just shot me in the heel with an arrow. (reaches down, grimacing) That or my foot’s pinned under the seat... Superimposed onscreen, a fourth TITLE: D) Love Hurts  60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s a little while later. The HUMMER ZOOMS to the WEST a pretty good clip. FLAGSTAFF and WICHITA sit in silence. I back, ALBUQUERQUE and STILLWATER battle like Ali and Fras

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: You guys gotta sleep sometime. Albuquerque DRAGS his finger from one ear, across his NEC to the other ear. Yep. The old slice-the-throat symbol. Stillwater smirks, takes her index finger that’s NOT on t shotgun trigger, SUCKS on it... and then twirls it into Albuquerque’s EAR. Yep. The old WET WILLY.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: (ballistic) You did not!

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: (to Wichita) He grows on you.

dialogues.speaker: WICHITA
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: WICHITA
dialogues.text: How ‘bout we play the quiet game? Starting now.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: I’ve been meaning to ask. You were coming from the direction of Flagstaff. You didn’t happen to..?

dialogues.speaker: WICHITA
dialogues.text: Never played the quiet game before? (off Flagstaff's lip-bite) Well they’re playing it in Flagstaff. Total ghost town. Burned to the ground. (turns to Albuquerque) Wait. You're... ‘Albuquerque?’ (off Albuquerque’s nod, turns back to Flagstaff, wincing) And you're... ‘Flagstaff?’ Flagstaff nods. The silence is deafening. He’s been hit square in the gut.  61.

dialogues.speaker: WICHITA
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry. I didn’t realize it was...

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ..-home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the same HOME VIDEOS from earlier of FLAGSTAFF as boy, with MOM and DAD. Dad hugs Flagstaff.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Where my family was supposed to be waiting. In my heart of hearts, I knew this day would come. The day home left me. For good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLAGSTAFF slowly sits back in his seat, his eyes misting with TEARS.

dialogues.speaker: WICHITA
dialogues.text: We'll take you as far as civilization. You can get a new car. Go see for yourself. Or else maybe... settle somewhere new. At last, STILLWATER reaches over and moves Flagstaff’s se BACK so his knees aren’t up in his face. As gestures go, it’s the best she can do... Flagstaff gives her an appreciative look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is about to go down over the desert. The HUMMER pulls OFF the freeway and into the driveway of an old, abandoned HOMESTEAD. FLAGSTAFF sits up, shaking off the cobwebs.

dialogues.speaker: WICHITA
dialogues.text: Just for the night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WICHITA, FLAGSTAFF, ALBUQUERQUE, and STILLWATER busy the homestead for a night’s sleep.  62. Flagstaff finishes snooping from room to room and enters kitchen, where WICHITA is poking around.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Zombie-free...

dialogues.speaker: WICHITA
dialogues.text: Cool. You... OK? Flagstaff shrugs, but gives her an optimistic smile: ‘und the circumstances...’

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Pretend you're Albuquerque. And she's a zombie. No fear. Nothing to lose. Wichita tries the faucet (there’s NO WATER). Then she sta going through cupboards, plucking out foodstuffs.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: So where you guys headed?

dialogues.speaker: WICHITA
dialogues.text: Disneyland. She’s never been.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Think this counts as off-season! Space Mountain will have a very manageable line. If you want, I can go with. Protect you from Tigger, case he’s gone zombie.

dialogues.speaker: WICHITA
dialogues.text: Tigger? No chance. He’s got crazy hops. (goes to that happy place) I always wanted to play Tigger. Imagine just standing there... and inspiring pure, adoring love. Angle on Flagstaff STARING at Wichita purely, adoringly, lovingly. She suddenly notices and looks uncomfortable, a he realizes.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: (covers) Yeah. Imagine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALBUQUERQUE places down BLANKETS and PILLOWS in the livin room, all in front of STILLWATER’s carefully aimed SHOTGU

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: It’s like a ‘jama party!  63.

dialogues.speaker: STILLWATER
dialogues.text: (dripping sarcasm) Yay!

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: A ‘jama party where if somebody falls asleep, they’re getting stabbed in the back between the ribs so the knife point enters their lung instead of their heart. That way they can’t draw breath to scream. (off Stillwater’s unconcerned stare) It’s OK to show fear. Wichita and Flagstaff enter the living room. Wichita toss CANS of FOOD to Albuquerque and Flagstaff.

dialogues.speaker: WICHITA
dialogues.text: When your tongue says ‘beets,’ make your brain hear ‘Twinkies!’ (to Stillwater) You take first watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s later in the living room. WICHITA lies asleep on the couch. FLAGSTAFF is konked out on the floor. ALBUQUERQUE sits in a chair eating canned BEETS with a spoon. STILLWA sits in the next chair, vigilantly WATCHING with her SHOT

dialogues.speaker: STILLWATER
dialogues.text: Can’t believe you like beets.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: They’re a natural stimulant. Keep a man awake. Whoa. Check this spoon. It’s SO... Albuquerque holds his spoon in front of Stillwater’s face SWINGING it SLOWLY from SIDE to SIDE to hypnotize her.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: .--Shiiiiny.

dialogues.speaker: STILLWATER
dialogues.text: Horse’s ass. Albuquerque immediately chucks the spoon over his shoulde

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Fine. But I’m crafty. Once I close my eyes?  64. (points to his face) You won't be able to tell the difference. Between ‘sleepy time.’ And ‘go time.’

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: ALBUQUERQUE, in the EXACT SAME spot, except now HILARIOUS OBVIOUSLY ASLEEP. Head bowed. Mouth ridiculously open. Drool forming. Gruesome SNORING NOISES. Stillwater smiles

dialogues.speaker: STILLWATER
dialogues.text: Gonna go with ‘sleepy time.’

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SUN comes in the window of the living room. WICHITA n sits in one of the chairs with the shotgun, guarding a sleeping STILLWATER, ALBUQUERQUE, and FLAGSTAFF. At the sight of the sunbeam, she walks to the window and looks at her reflection in the glass. Grimy skin. Stringy hair. She smells something unpleasant, then realizes it’s simply HERSELF, sniffing under her arm with a GRIMACE. Wichita is examining her reflection again when her eyes WIDEN. We RACK FOCUS from the pane of glass to the VIEW beyond, BEHIND the homestead. There, elevated about five feet off the ground, is a big WATER DRUM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WICHITA MARCHES across the yard, holding some SUPPLIES. S KNOCKS on the side of the drum and hears a watery ECHO. T she stacks the supplies next to the drum. A HOSE... a sma HACK-SAW... some DUCT-TAPE.. A HAMMER... a big DRILL BIT. .-.and a BAR of SOAP and BOTTLE of SHAMPOO. Wichita goes to work. In close-up, we see her SAWING the HOSE. Using the BIT and HAMMER to punch a HOLE in the sid of the drum. Inserting the hose piece. Taping it tight. KINKING the hose. Then UNKINKING it for a moment to see t water SPILL OUT onto her hand. Crystal clear. But COLD. Wichita KINKS the hose again just in time for STILLWATER walk outside. Wichita shows off her handiwork.

dialogues.speaker: WICHITA
dialogues.text: Shower?

dialogues.speaker: STILLWATER
dialogues.text: Nuh-uh!  65.

dialogues.speaker: WICHITA
dialogues.text: We'll let the sun heat the water. Meantime, you guard the truck. I’m searching the storage shed. (pauses ) What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: STILLWATER
dialogues.text: (overcome with giddiness) I love you very much.

dialogues.speaker: WICHITA
dialogues.text: Society? Collapsed. Population? Destroyed. Hair? Bouncy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLAGSTAFF stirs awake on the floor next to a still-sleepi ALBUQUERQUE.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: There are two moments familiar to anyone who's lived in Zombieland: the moment you wake up in the morning, right before you remember about zombies. Flagstaff opens his eyes, obliviously happy.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And then the moment you remember. Flagstaff’s expression immediately grows anxious. He take deep breath, then gathers his courage to face the day.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It's a scary world out there, but someone's gotta poop their pants in it. Might as well be me. Flagstaff stands up and strides outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLAGSTAFF walks into the storage shed, where he hears a b of BANGING. He discovers WICHITA, back turned to him, BEN OVER, looking through some BOXES. He stands perfectly still, silently, mesmerized by the si of her ASS.  66.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I've kept quiet in some tight spots. But never this quiet. And never that... tight. Suddenly, Wichita catches a GLIMPSE of Flagstaff ogling h from under her arm. She SPINS around.

dialogues.speaker: WICHITA
dialogues.text: Creepy.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: I can explain. Mm. No. I can’t. (indicating ‘bye’) I’1l just be...

dialogues.speaker: WICHITA
dialogues.text: .--helping me look through boxes?

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Yes'm! (can’t believe that came out) ‘Yes’m?’ What is this, civil war Atlanta?! Yes ma’am. Even though you

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: don’t seem like a... ma’am. (shuffles toward boxes) I am a good... helper... of... looking through... boxes...

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: If anyone gets a clean shot, take me out. Flagstaff and Wichita go through boxes side-by-side.

dialogues.speaker: WICHITA
dialogues.text: Don’t take this wrong. But I will never, ever sleep with you.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Totally fine! (thinks) Even if we were the last two..?

dialogues.speaker: WICHITA
dialogues.text: ...-people on earth? (shakes head) Actual danger of that.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: (thinks, smirks) I get handsomer by the death! The two start to chuckle.  67.

dialogues.speaker: WICHITA
dialogues.text: So how’s my ass? Tiggerific?

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Right, I’m going there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now ALBUQUERQUE saunters out into the back yard, yawning stretching, rubbing crumbs from his eyes. He stops. Frown Puts on his GLASSES. Spies the jury-rigged SHOWER.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Albuquerque, now NAKED, under the hose, letting the water POUR all over him. He luxuriates in it, picks up the SOAP SCRUB-A-DUB-DUBS... Next he starts GARGLING with the water... SPRAYING it out his mouth like a GARGOYLE... vigorously SLAPPING his CHES Then SHAMPOOING... reaching for the shampoo bottle AGAIN.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Lather... rinse... repeat... (sings from the old ad) Gonna wash that gray right outta my hair!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WICHITA and FLAGSTAFF stop what they’re doing and LISTEN the sound of distant SINGING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STILLWATER turns. She, too, can hear the singing, even LOUDER. She strains to hear the words.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (soft, distant) Gonna wash that gray right outta my hair!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We’re on ALBUQUERQUE in medium shot, back turned to the homestead, still showering, when we see three blurry FIGU enter the frame BEHIND him. He kneads his muscles, tosses back his head like a supermodel, then freezes, opening hi eyes. We RACK FOCUS to WICHITA, STILLWATER, and FLAGSTAFF stand behind the homestead, watching. Albuquerque turns around faces them.  68.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Come on in! The water’s... The shower suddenly SLOWS to a TRICKLE. Albuquerque frown

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: ...fine? Albuquerque checks the hose, which has begun merely to DR Could it be? He bangs on the tub. The water is GONE! We pan slowly from Flagstaff to Wichita to Stillwater... one looking grimier and grosser than the one before... ea one looking more MURDEROUS than the one before. Albuquerque’s gaze narrows.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: That’s my bad right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HUMMER literally SPRAYS DUST as it LAUNCHES out of th driveway... leaving ALBUQUERQUE and FLAGSTAFF BEHIND yet AGAIN. Albuquerque and Flagstaff watch the girls drive off in silence. Albuquerque knocks a little water out of his ear Flagstaff slowly turns to stare daggers into him.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: I’m just as disappointed as you are.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: (all business) ‘Bout a mile back. We passed a car... behind some bushes. We gotta catch her! (covers) Uhh... them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We’re now in a TWO-SHOT of ALBUQUERQUE and FLAGSTAFF, DRI down the freeway again. They’re covered in flop sweat fro the car hunt. Albuquerque’s in a foul mood.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Bitches! Fool me once, shame on me. Fool me twice, shame on you. Fool me three... Wait, it’s once, you. Twice, me. Three..?  69. (bewildered) Who’s the shame on?

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: You.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Go fuck yourself. And the same to the pussy who drove this P.O.S. The CAMERA immediately PULLS BACK to REVEAL Albuquerque a Flagstaff, backs HUNCHED, heads BOWED in an tiny old GEO METRO.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Once I work out this neck crick. Payback time. Albuquerque FLOORS the METRO, WITHOUT CONSEQUENCE. Beyond frustrated, he pulls back on the steering wheel over and as though trying to rip it out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE LANE MARKERS hypnotically zoom past as Grandmaster Flash’s ‘WHITE LINES’ thumps, albeit distortedly, from th Metro’s blown, tinny tweeters. We're on the outskirts of Los Angeles. We see a SIGN: ‘Entering Los Angeles County.’ A spray-painted ‘t’ punctuating ‘Los.’

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (repeating the famous lyrics) ‘Ticket to ride the white line highway.’ I know what you're thinking. The white lines are moving in the wrong direction... back where I started. The music dips.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But Zombieland has a way of messing with your sense of direction. Now I'm after the girl. Until I find her, I could do a lot worse than my old friend Beverly... Hills. L.A. looks EERILY EMPTY.  70.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: (nervous ) Honest? I kinda miss the traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GEO METRO coasts past the mansions of Beverly Hills. ALBUQUERQUE is driving. FLAGSTAFF is looking around anxiously. ‘White Lines’ has been replaced by an creepy, suspenseful cue. Flagstaff sees MOVEMENT in some Oleander bushes, but whatever caused it is quickly gone.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: We gotta find somewhere safe. Now. Trust me, L.A.’s messed up.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Yeah? Me too. (looks, frowns) Not gonna lie. I pictured Tom Cruise living somewhere nicer. Wanna try Jay Leno's? FLAGSTAFF raises a MAP in front of his FACE... but not ju any map, a STAR MAP. He and Albuquerque have been trollin the neighborhood for a pad to set up shop.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: (eyes light up) Slow-slow-slow! Albuquerque slows down, and Flagstaff points out a MONSTR GORGEOUS 5-ACRE COMPOUND, surrounded by a FENCE, dense FOLIAGE, and a massive wrought-iron GATE with an ‘S’ in t center. He looks back toward the Oleander bushes across t street, where a CREEPY ZOMBIE parts the bushes and STARES

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: (points) Fast-fast-fast! Albuquerque PEELS OUT, SWINGS a DOUGHNUT in front of the gate, and PARKS. Flagstaff FUMBLES with his DOOR HANDLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUD! Albuquerque’s DUFFEL BAG lands in a clump of foliag followed by... THUNK... Flagstaff’s ROLLER SUITCASE. WHAC FLAGSTAFF and ALBUQUERQUE JUMP DOWN from the FENCE and in the back yard of the compound.  71. Then... BOOM! The ZOMBIE who was watching them SMASHES in the fence on the other side, SHAKING it angrily, REACHING futilely through the bars from mere feet away. Albuquerque ignores the zombie and sets off through THICK UNDERBRUSH to make it into the yard itself. Flagstaff fearfully gathers their stuff and follows him, still play the role of the Sherpa. Albuquerque emerges from the foliage, followed by Flagsta who STOPS to carefully examine his own clothes, limbs, an hair. Albuquerque looks back at Flagstaff questioningly.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Tick check. Albuquerque rolls his eyes and continues toward the MANSI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FRENCH DOOR opens onto a downstairs REC ROOM. ALBUQUERQ walks quietly into the house, followed by FLAGSTAFF. There’s a POOL TABLE in the middle of the room. Albuquerq grabs a POOL STICK and TOSSES it to Flagstaff. Then he ta one for himself. Not the most deadly of weapons, but they have to do for now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLAGSTAFF and ALBUQUERQUE, pool sticks at the ready, clim the stairs to the main floor, dominated by a gorgeous LIV ROOM. There, spread all around the room, are monuments to the career of a certain Hollywood actor: POSTERS of ‘The Outsiders.’ ‘Road House.’ ‘Red Dawn.’ A SURFBOARD from ‘Point Break’ (sitting on a saw-horse). A RICKSHAW from ‘City of Joy.’ Albuquerque stops in front of the posters. He looks giddy Maybe even a little overwhelmed.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Welcome to La Casa De Swayze.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Confession? Patrick Swayze was my hero. I can say that, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can. You shouldn't...

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: I was just a kid. My Dad was outta the picture. And that’s when I saw ‘The Outsiders.’ Cruise. Macchio. Lowe. Thomas-Howell.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Think it’s just ‘Howell.’

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: (completely ignores this) Estevez. Dillon. And Patrick Swayze. Rest of ‘em weren’t fit to hold his jock. And after ‘Outsiders?’ ‘Renegades.’ ‘Red Dawn.’ ‘Road House.’ Albuquerque executes a KARATE MOVE from the movie.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Quite a run.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: I modeled my life after Swayze’s. Then just like that, it ended. My sis brought home a Betamax of Swayze’s latest movie. I sat and watched my hero slip on a tank top. And dance the Pachanga. (snaps out of it) You imagine what that was like?

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: (nods ) I saw the movie.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Dirty. Fucking. Dancing. Never has a man who kicked so much ass... shaken... so much ass. (angry far-off stare) I never forgave the son-of-a-bitch. INT. PATRICK SWAYZE’S KITCHEN - DAY Albuquerque finishes throwing open a series of CUPBOARDS.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: And no Twinkies either! Albuquerque SLAMS shut the nearest cupboard ANGRILY.  73.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: I knew we shoulda gone to Travolta’s!

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: (whispers... ‘be quiet!’) Hello... ‘inside voice!’ ‘Til we make sure we’re alone. You take upstairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALBUQUERQUE makes sure the coast is clear in the master suite, confidently striding around the room, pausing to admire the WIDE-SCREEN TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By contrast, a trepidant FLAGSTAFF uses his POOL STICK to flip a light switch in the downstairs laundry room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALBUQUERQUE searches an exercise room, pausing to do a co CABLE-PULLEY CROSSOVER chest exercises in the mirror. Sti got it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLAGSTAFF peers into a powder room, scrunches up his face disgust, and uses his pool stick to FLUSH the TOILET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Albuquerque searches a guest bedroom, nearly STEPPING ON FAILING to NOTICE) a GRIMY HAND protruding from under the bed. The hand remains still, and Albuquerque exits the ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLAGSTAFF and ALBUQUERQUE spot each other... Albuquerque the top of the stairs, Flagstaff at the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: All clear?

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Crystal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALBUQUERQUE is back in the master suite, where he opens t DVD PLAYER to find ‘Road House’ already sitting in it.  74.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Excellent... Albuquerque plops onto the master bed and watches ‘Road House’ on the wide screen TV. He’s cued up the scene wher the bad guy wields a POOL STICK in the bar, swinging it around like a martial arts STAFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Downstairs, FLAGSTAFF finds a STEREO and flips it on. He checks the CD inside. No way...

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: What were the chances. (thinks ) Actually probably pretty good. For fun, he cues up the right track, CRANKS up the volume and hits ‘play.’ We hear the first, distinctive notes of Bill Medley’s and Jennifer Warnes’s ‘(I'VE HAD) THE TIME OF MY LIFE’ from t ‘Dirty Dancing’ soundtrack. As Flagstaff walks back acros the living room, a little ashamed, he can’t suppress the TINIEST of dance moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're back upstairs, where we can now hear the music BLAS from downstairs. Still motionless underneath the bed that Albuquerque forgot to look under... is the HAND. And protruding from another side of the bed... a BARE FOO In time to the music, the foot starts to involuntarily TA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLAGSTAFF emerges from the kitchen with a tall glass of I WATER, embarrassedly mouthing the words to the song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BODY under the bed CRAWLS OUT and STANDS UP. We only a good glimpse of the LEGS and bare FEET, blood-spattered but none the worse for wear. They walk out of the room gracefully, as if belonging to a dancer, IN TIME TO THE MUSIC.  75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLAGSTAFF spies another treasure in the living room: The POTTER'S WHEEL from ‘Ghost.’ This is just too much of a guilty pleasure. He embarrassedly sashays over to it and pops the lid on a BUCKET next to the wheel. There’s still CLAY inside! Flagstaff sits at the wheel, grabs a chunk of clay, and uses some of his glass of WATE WET it DOWN. Then he turns ON the machine, lets the wheel get up to sp and starts to make a POT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As ‘(I'VE HAD) THE TIME OF MY LIFE’ continues to play, th ZOMBIFIED LEGS/FEET start walking down the stairs. Very gracefully. And still in time to the beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, ALBUQUERQUE can’t really hear the music downstairs. He’s still way too engrossed in ‘Road House.’ Swayze is lighting up the screen in a knock-down drag-out fight with the villain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLAGSTAFF is shaping his CLAY into a cylinder, making it rise, totally into it... ..-when a figure approaches him from behind, still out of focus, still oddly graceful somehow. The figure lowers into frame, wrapping its arms AROUND Flagstaff, then finally closing its hands around Flagstaf hands on the spinning CLAY. It’s as though Flagstaff has been ELECTRIFIED. He YELPS a LEAPS into the air, STEPPING onto the SPINNING wheel. He immediately loses his balance and FALLS back onto the whe Its momentum SHOOTS him to one side, clear of the ominous figure. Flagstaff rolls to his knees and STARES up into the face the one... the only... ..-»PATRICK SWAYZE. Now zombiefied. Horrifying. And not just because of the bleeding eyes. Tight jeans. Tank top. And early-stages MULLET. For so many reasons... Flagstaff SCREAMS.  76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simultaneously, Kelly Lynch SCREAMS at the sight of the f in ‘Road House,’ MASKING Flagstaff’s scream downstairs. ALBUQUERQUE couldn’t be more entranced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still set to the bouncy, upbeat song, FLAGSTAFF SPRINTS around the living room with SWAYZE in hot pursuit. It’s a totally frenetic CHASE-TO-THE-DEATH. Over counter- tops. Coffee tables. Across the clay-spattered marble, which causes both Flagstaff and Swayze to SLIP and FALL. Flagstaff’s feet struggle to gain traction on the wet cla but he manages to dive UNDER the ‘Point Break’ surf board then bounces back to his FEET, keeping it between him and Swayze.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Please! I actually kinda liked you in ‘Point Break!’ Swayze BULL-RUSHES, knocking the surf board AND Flagstaff the ground. He manages to grab hold of Flagstaff's shoe. Flagstaff, desperate for any advantage, grabs the SURF BOARD’s LEASH and tethers it to Swayze’s ANKLE. Then his CLAY-SPATTERED shoe SLIPS from Swayze’s grasp, but not be it POPS OFF at the HEEL. Flagstaff scurries away, trying unsuccessfully to stomp his heel back down into the shoe. Swayze SPRINTS after Flagstaff again. The SURF BOARD drag behind his ankle, TUGGED by its leash. It SWINGS in a WID ARC and CRUSHES the potter’s wheel. The spinning wheel ENTANGLES the leash and YANKS Swayze back to the floor. Flagstaff finally stoops to pull his shoe back over his h Like lightning, Swayze undoes the leash from his ankle an KIPS UP to his FEET. An awed Flagstaff dashes toward the far side of the room again, rolling the ‘City of Joy’ RICKSHAW between himself Swayze. Swayze merely BALLET-LEAPS over it. At last, Swayze HORSE-COLLARS Flagstaff and spins him aro From our vantage point across the room, it looks like the very well MIGHT be DANCING! Flagstaff raises an arm to protect himself, but Swayze gr it and TWIRLS him closer. As Swayze finally pulls him int his clutches, a VOICE rings out.  77.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: May I cut in? Swayze, holding Flagstaff like a dance partner, looks up see ALBUQUERQUE, standing at the bottom of the stairs, holding the POOL STICK menacingly at his side. Albuquerque slowly steps forward. For effect, he tries to SPIN and TWIRL the pool stick around like the villain in movie. Only he’s terrible at it. He hilariously BANGS the stick off a lamp, then off the marble floor, which SNAPS nearly in half. Albuquerque spends a couple seconds trying to force the t halves back together, then CHUCKS it ASIDE. Gonna rely on the fists. He POINTS his index finger at Swayze, then tur it around and BECKONS him, as if to say, ‘Come and get it

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Let’s dance. Swayze stares at Albuquerque, uncomprehending behind the rage.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Um. By ‘dance,’ he means ‘fight.’ The Swayze zombie has heard enough. He TOSSES Flagstaff ASIDE and SPRINTS across the room toward Albuquerque. Swayze snarls. Albuquerque bellows back. At last, when he is within a couple feet of Albuquerque, Swayze LEAPS FORWARD at him! Albuquerque CATCHES Swayze at the WAIST with BOTH HANDS a LIFTS him UP in the air until they are forming a ‘T,’ Albuquerque with his hands straight overhead and Swayze d a swan dive parallel to the ground. That’s right, it’s the classic ‘LIFT’ performed by Swayze Grey at the end of ‘Dirty Dancing.’ Except this lift sees SWAYZE’s momentum carry him HEAD-FI into a PILLAR in the living room. There is a sickening CRUNCH, and Albuquerque DROPS a sudd lifeless Swayze - KER-THUNK - to the ground. As if on cue Flagstaff picks up the stereo remote and KILLS the MUSIC.  78.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: (repeats the classic line from ‘Dirty Dancing’) Nobody puts Baby in a corner. Flagstaff’s heel finally PLOPS down into his shoe. He wal over to Albuquerque, who angrily KICKS the motionless SWA once for each career misstep.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: That’s for ‘Dirty Dancing!’ That’s for ‘City of Joy!’ That’s for ‘Father Hood!’ Superimposed onscreen: A TITLE: 3. Double Tap. The title FLASHES once for each of Albuquerque’s kicks.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: And that’s for ‘Havana Nights!’ Flagstaff dispenses a KICK of his own, then allows himsel little SMILE. Superimposed onscreen: A TITLE: 32. Enjoy the Little Things

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: So whaddya think? ‘Zombie Kill of the Week?’ Brought to you by... Mrs. Renfro’s Black Bean Salsa?

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Close, but no cigar. Zombie Kill of the Week honors already went out to Cynthia Newsome of Monroe, Louisiana...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We suddenly find ourselves in a sweet southern suburban neighborhood. A sixty-something woman, CYNTHIA NEWSOME, drives reckless into her driveway, SCREAMING. There is a ZOMBIE CRAWLING through the SUNROOF of her Chevy Malibu as she drives, tr to BITE her. Its waist and legs PROTRUDE out the top of t car. Cynthia hits the BUTTON of her GARAGE DOOR REMOTE. The garage DOOR starts to open, slowly rising up.  79. Instead of waiting for the door to rise all the way, Cynt guns the accelerator. The door CUTS the ZOMBIE in HALF at the waist.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Impressive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With comical difficulty, FLAGSTAFF and ALBUQUERQUE try to lift PATRICK SWAYZE, now SHROUDED in a sheet, UP and OVER fence surrounding the compound and into the YARD next doo

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: (straining under the weight) Actually glad... we’re not... at... Travolta’s... After some slapsticky moments, they finally manage to hea the body over the fence. Swayze's corpse TUMBLES down the slope into the YARD on the other side, ROLLING out of its sheet in the process. Flagstaff bites his lip.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: He deserved better. Wrapping, I mean. The pair looks at one another. Should we bother? Nah. The TURN and walk back toward the house. Flagstaff takes out small plastic BOTTLE and SQUIRTS some solution on his HAN

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Purell?

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Please. Flagstaff TOSSES Albuquerque the bottle. Albuquerque uses some Purell, then tosses it back.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Think Sigourney Weaver will get pissed when she finds Swayze in her yard?

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Ripley can deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALBUQUERQUE and FLAGSTAFF are living it up, Swayze style. They’re having a SCHVITZ in Patrick’s STEAM ROOM. We pan from Albuquerque to Flagstaff. Albuquerque is wrapped in ‘HIS’ towel, Flagstaff stuck with ‘HERS.’  80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALBUQUERQUE and FLAGSTAFF lounge in two big plush CHAIRS Swayze’s bedroom. Albuquerque is now in Swayze’s SILK ROBE... and COWBOY BOOTS. Flagstaff, by contrast, is sporting high-waisted SLACKS and a big-collared shirt, straight from Swayze’s ‘Road House’ days. They’re both looking and feeling refreshed. Relaxed. In the master suite is a huge OIL PAINTING of Patrick bar backing a HORSE, his mullet blowing in the wind. On the table to Flagstaff’s right is a BOX: ‘Conversation Starters.’ Why not? Flagstaff reaches in and picks a card

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: You’re throwing a dinner party. You can invite five people, dead or alive...

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: First two... easy. Elvis. Brando. This is where it gets interesting. Kylie Minogue. Don’t ask. Cuatro? Mother Theresa. (pauses, contemplative) And last but not least. Buck.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Says people. Not pets. You get one more.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: (angry) It’s my God Damn dinner party. I want Buck. End of fucking discussion. An awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: (reads off box, faux excited) ‘Conversation Starters!’ Flagstaff tosses the game across the room.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: (far off look) Never thought I could love anything like Buck. Day he was born, I lost my mind. He was just like me. ‘Cept littler. Had my personality. My laugh. My appetite...  81. Flagstaff is nodding as he listens, right to the point wh he stops nodding, looking puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: ‘Laugh?’ Suddenly, Flagstaff’s expression freezes with recognition

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And just like that, I knew. I felt so ashamed. That it had taken me this long. Me, with the best cardio in the business, to realize: I wasn't the only one running from something... FLAGSTAFF looks sympathetically at ALBUQUERQUE, who’s got mist in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: (almost whispered) We still talking about a dog? Albuquerque’s face reveals untold pain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see ALBUQUERQUE, pre-Zombieland, cooking PANCAKES. It the SAME flashback from earlier in the story... .--only THIS TIME, Albuquerque isn’t cooking for a dog, b BOY. Albuquerque’s SON. BUCK. Two years old. Sandy blond hair. Sporting a Janikowski Raiders jersey. We see a series of quick FLASHES - the very same scenes w saw earlier, only now with the BOY instead of the dog... Glimpses of Albuquerque WATCHING HAPPILY as his SON gobbl up the pancakes... Albuquerque running in and out of frame, carrying Buck up the air, zooming him around like an AIRPLANE... Albuquerque, falling to the ground with Buck, blowing RASPBERRIES on his BELLY and ESKIMO-KISSING him... ALBUQUERQUE, giving BUCK a BATH. The little boy wearing s goggles. And a baby SPEEDO.  82. Albuquerque shapes Buck’s hair into a MOHAWK. Buck giggle infectiously. Albuquerque melts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALBUQUERQUE turns to meet FLAGSTAFF’s stare.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Take away a man's son, you've truly given him nothing left to lose. A single tear trickles from behind Albuquerque’s glasses his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Got any... pictures? Albuquerque nods, reaches for his WALLET, and hands it to Flagstaff. The very act of admitting the truth causes Albuquerque to break down weeping. Flagstaff looks at the cute wallet PHOTOS of Albuquerque’ LOST BOY BUCK... then at last reaches across and puts one hand on Albuquerque’s SHOULDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HONK! ALBUQUERQUE comes out of the master bathroom back i the master suite, BLOWING his NOSE loudly into some KLEEN

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Jezus. Haven’t cried like that since... well... ‘Ghost.’ Sorry if I got kinda gay.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Blame me.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: (smirks ) If the high-waisted slacks fit...

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Says the man in the paisley silk robe and cowboy boots. Albuquerque smiles more fully and looks pensively at the painting of Patrick and his stallion, trying to reestabli an atmosphere of heterosexuality.  83.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Man. If I was Swayze back in the day... I woulda pulled down so much ass.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Me too. Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s later in the day, and we’re now in the MASTER BATH. FLAGSTAFF, dressed in his own clothes again, is rifling through Swayze’s MEDICINE CABINET. Not as much for suppli as to satisfy his curiosity...

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: (to himself) People Magazine’s Sexiest Man Alive, 1991... what’s your secret?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALBUQUERQUE, also dressed in his regular clothes again (a holding a couple sets of CAR KEYS), tours Swayze’s garage There sits a gorgeous black YUKON DENALI SUV. He unlocks Denali, looks around inside, and lights up at the sight o BUTTON on the DASH. He jabs the button and waits.

dialogues.speaker: DETROIT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: On-Star, how can I help you... Mr... (a beat) .«.-Swayze?

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: (disguises voice) Hey, baby. Please, call me Pat.

dialogues.speaker: DETROIT, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Thought we’d been through this, Mr. Swayze. Make one more inappropriate pass, and I lock you out of your car. Again. Albuquerque can’t help CRACKING UP. CLICK. Detroit HANGS UP. Albuquerque frowns and hits the On-Star button severa more times. At last...

dialogues.speaker: DETROIT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (dispensing with the usual politeness) I told you..!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detroit, it’s me! Albuquerque! You 84. don’t hafta worry about Swayze any more! (a moment of silence) He’s Sigourney Weaver’s problem now.

dialogues.speaker: DETROIT, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Albie, sweetheart! Praise Jesus. Been worried about ya! You guys OK? The Hummer’s totaled! Albuquerque perks up and assumes a look of smug SATISFACT

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: You just saved me my next question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLAGSTAFF and ALBUQUERQUE ARGUE in the FOYER. Flagstaff’s hair is slicked back. He’s obviously partaken of Swayze’s styling ‘products.’

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: But we have to try to help! Rollover alert, crumple zone alert, airbags deployed?! They’re probably lying out there right now, bleeding... trapped...

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: (enjoying the sound) I’m painting a mental picture.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: You don’t mean that! Albuquerque hears the pain in Flagstaff’s voice.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Oh. My. God. You like Wichita!

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Get outta here!

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: You’ve been thinking of fucking her? Wish granted! She’s spent the last twenty-four hours fucking you! I ain’t helping. Those two deserve what they get. some of

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Suit yourself. (off Albuquerque’s inquisitive look) But their pictures were once in someone’s wallet, too. Flagstaff walks out. Albuquerque stands silently, knowing he’s suddenly and completely LOST the debate. He sighs.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Starting to hate that skinny little douche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DENALI ZOOMS EAST on the 10 FREEWAY, another big WHIT NUMBER ‘3’ scrawled on both sides and the hood. ALBUQUERQ is driving. FLAGSTAFF is in the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DENALI pulls onto an OFF-RAMP that overlooks a GAS STATION MINI-MART. It comes to a STOP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALBUQUERQUE and FLAGSTAFF crane their necks to look down. They SPOT the HUMMER, OVERTURNED on the street outside th Mini-Mart, SMASHED into a TELEPHONE POLE. It is SWARMING with SIX or so ZOMBIES, inside and out. There are various other zombies perched around the Mini-Mart parking lot. P some OTHERS lurching down nearby streets. WICHITA and STILLWATER are obviously TOAST.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Rest their souls. Flagstaff looks DEVASTATED. He opens the door and jumps o of the Denali to TOSS his COOKIES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLAGSTAFF and ALBUQUERQUE, are now in a heated discussion the DENALI, at the top of the off-ramp.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Are your glasses foggy?! It’s over! I’m not driving down there! They’re crawling all over the place...  86.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: With or without you, I’m going.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Look. I was the one who wanted to save the girls. But they’re gone!

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: It’s not the girls I’m after. Flagstaff stares, uncomprehending. Then he REALIZES.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Ohhhh no. You’d risk our lives for a... (off Albuquerque's nod) ..-Twinkie?! Nice logic, smart guy! Won’t stick out your neck for a person! But a Twinkie! Did I mention I made perfectly good macaroni salad... Albuquerque STARES Flagstaff down, LIVID. A few beats pas Albuquerque is on the verge of creaming someone. Flagstaf is on the verge of BEING CREAMED by someone.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: ‘Smart guy’?

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: (realizes he’s on thin, thin ice) Let me begin my three-part apology by saying...

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: No, it’s OK. Albuquerque takes a deep, relaxing breath. All is good.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: But FYI... I’ve beat wholesale ass for less than that. Flagstaff almost says something, then thinks better of it

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: I’m gonna explain. And then this United States Citizen is driving Pat Swayze's Yukon Denali to the local Mini-Mart for some Twinkies. With or without the kind of pussy who eats macaroni salad.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: I unreservedly apologize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not listening) There’s a box of Twinkies down in that Mini-Mart. Not just any box of Twinkies. The last box of Twinkies... that I... or anyone... will enjoy... for all of time... in the whole universe. ‘Cause there’s an expiration date on Twinkies. And the Hostess factories are gone. So some day very soon, life’s little Twinkie gauge is gonna hit Empty. Albuquerque reaches into the back seat and grabs his DUFF BAG, which he holds on his LAP.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Now, true... you probably won’t survive the next ten minutes. But if you do, you'll be one of the last two guys in the universe to enjoy the spongy outside and creamy inside of a delicious Twinkie. Worth it, right?

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: No. And I’m so scared, I’m about to shit my pants. For which there’s precedent. Flagstaff picks up one of the new SHOTGUNS, grabs his rol suitcase, and opens the passenger door.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: So this is goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Fair enough. As a couple... we were pretty...

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Odd?

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: I was gonna say crappy. One favor?

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: (conspiratorial, as in ‘your secret’s safe with me’) Got a last known address for Ms. Beverly... Hills?  88.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Like I would give that to you!

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: (beat) Well, I’m no good at goodbyes, so... (stumped) ..-that’ll do, pig.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: That’s the worst goodbye I’ve ever heard. And you stole it from a movie.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Totally embarrassing. Get outta the truck. Flagstaff steps out onto the running board. But he can’t quite bring himself to jump from the DENALI. Instead, he LINGERS, standing on the running board, looking at the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Go on...

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Albuquerque once said: You know home by the way it makes you feel when you leave. That face? That's me realizing that at least for now, this stupid big truck in this silly little neighborhood, and that stupid big guy in those silly little glasses? They were as close as I was gonna get... to home. Flagstaff tosses his suitcase BACK INTO THE SUV. He plops down in the PASSENGER SEAT, FASTENS HIS SEATBELT, and COC HIS SHOTGUN.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Let’s fuck us up some Twinkies. Albuquerque nods and slings the duffel bag over his SHOUL

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Buckle up.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Way ahead of you. Albuquerque goes to PUNCH Flagstaff in the ARM hard, but slows down at the last second, barely TAPPING him.  89.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Almost forgot... Albuquerque reaches up and hits the ON-STAR BUTTON again.

dialogues.speaker: DETROIT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: On-Star. How can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Detroit, Albuquerque. Bad news. Really bad.

dialogues.speaker: DETROIT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (long pause) Rest their souls.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: That’s exactly what I said! We’re about to stir some shit up anyway.

dialogues.speaker: DETROIT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: No way I can talk you out of it?

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Nah. But if we go silent, send a posse.

dialogues.speaker: DETROIT, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: You realize I have, like, five total clients.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Six if Flagstaff makes it through.

dialogues.speaker: DETROIT, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The nearest friendly car is in... Provo, Utah, so don’t expect a rescue party. (repeats her signature line) Good luck. God bless. (pause) And thank you for using On-Star... CLICK.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Can we go back to the part where I don’t survive the next ten minutes? Albuquerque smirks and slides on a pair of prescription b SUNGLASSES.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Gonna be a hairy ten minutes.  90. We're high above the DENALI at the top of the OFF-RAMP, poised for the greatest orgy of gun-powder in zombie hist Superimposed onscreen: A TITLE CARD: Twinkies The engine RUMBLES. We're back inside...

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Ready?

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Ready-ish. Albuquerque reaches down and turns ON his HIGHLY AMPLIFIE CAR STEREO. There’s only one SONG in the world that could accompany Albuquerque as he does what he’s about to do: CYPRESS HILL’S ‘(ROCK) SUPERSTAR.’ The equalizer starts to JUMP. The song begins its BUILD. We're in SLOW MOTION, getting ready for some violence: Flagstaff STRETCHES his triceps... Albuquerque TURNS OFF AIR CONDITIONING and REVS the ACCELERATOR... the ENGINE GROWLS behind the GRILLE... One of the MANY ZOMBIES in the PARKING LOT and around the HUMMER looks up to locate the source of the ENGINE... Albuquerque GRABS the GEAR SHIFT and PULLS IT DOWN from ‘ to ‘N’ to ‘D.’ Flagstaff grabs the JESUS STRIP (that litt handle above the car door)... the back tires SPIN, throwi off BLUE SMOKE... The DENALI BUCKS and GALLOPS down the off-ramp... All the ZOMBIES perk up, drawn to the noise. Suddenly, we back at REGULAR SPEED... Albuquerque drives with one hand, screaming down the ramp gaining speed... faster... FASTER... ...-then cuts the wheel at the bottom and AIMS for the PA LOT. The Denali nearly goes up on TWO WHEELS. The music is POUNDING.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: They’11 run!  91.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: I know. The zombies start to move en masse toward the oncoming tr Albuquerque aims slightly to the RIGHT of their cluster. The zombies start to step to Albuquerque’s LEFT to get ou the way. Albuquerque holds his course. The zombies BAIL OUT to the LEFT. Will Albuquerque MISS

dialogues.speaker: ALTOGETHER
dialogues.text: At the last possible moment, Albuquerque PULLS the EMERGE BRAKE and YANKS the WHEEL to the RIGHT. The SUV’s back en starts SKIDDING around to the LEFT... ...it’s the beginning of that classic ROCKFORD FILES fast DEGREE TURN. The zombies are still BAILING LEFT when... .-The long BACK END of the DENALI SWINGS the REST of the around, SWATTING them all down. BANG, BANG, BANG... they all DROP like BOWLING PINS. Albuquerque completes the maneuver, sliding backwards pas the tangled MESS of FALLEN ZOMBIES. Flagstaff is awestruck. That was unbelievable. Albuquerque hits the FOUR-WHEEL-DRIVE button. Then drives OVER the zombies as if they were SPEED-BUMPS. Then he jams it into REVERSE and BACKS OVER them again. Superimposed onscreen: A TITLE: 3. Double Tap Flagstaff has his head out the window, watching the zombi bodies get MUSHED under the truck. He pulls his head back into the cab and looks at Albuquerque, majorly impressed. Without pause, Albuquerque PARKS the DENALI next to some PUMPS, steps out onto the RUNNING BOARD, and yanks someth from his DUFFEL BAG: An AIR-HORN. He aims it into the air and BLASTS three tim in succession, in perfect beat to the MUSIC. Flagstaff'’s EYES WIDEN in fear. We see THREE QUICK-CUTS of groups of ZOMBIES in nearby ar PERKING UP at the sound of the HORN: a VACANT LOT, a VIDE STORE, a TACO STAND.  92.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Flagstaff?

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Albuquerque.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Get on the roof. The hood’s twelve o'clock. The trunk’s six. You’re my eyes. Flagstaff NODS and tries to CLAMBER onto the ROOF of the Denali. He slips and BANGS his KNEE in the attempt. Flagstaff shakes off the pain, makes it onto the roof, an begins searching for zombies. We take his P.O.V. as he spins, looking for movement. He spies a TRIO on the move toward the DENALI at the EIGH O'CLOCK POSITION.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Uh, two o'clock! Wait, the hood was twelve? Crap! Eight o’clock! Ever see the gunfight in the movie ‘Heat’? That’s the kin of intensity Albuquerque is about to deliver. He plucks h STEYR AUG OUT of his BAG and walks around the SUV to the eight o’clock position. Albuquerque leans against the SUV to steady his aim, then FIRES. BAM-BAM-BAM-BAM-BAM! We didn’t know guns could be this lo FIRE spitting out of the muzzle. SHELLS stinging the pavement. Zombies FACE-PLANTING. Flagstaff pauses to watch, then snaps out of it and conti to scan the horizon for fast-approaching zombies.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Eleven! Albuquerque CIRCLES the SUV, kneels against the front bum to steady himself, and starts FIRING AGAIN. ZOMBIES DROP. One tries to get back up. BAM! Another shot.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Six!

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Nine!

dialogues.speaker: JOG, JOG, BAM-BAM-BAM-BAM-BAM-BAM
dialogues.text: We're HIGH ABOVE the DENALI, looking from a BIRD’S-EYE-VI as ZOMBIES run from distant locations toward the truck, f virtually EVERY angle. SLAP! Another BANANA CLIP goes into the GUN.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Four!

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Two! BAM-BAM-JAM-CLICK. The gun has JAMMED. Albuquerque wrestles with it for a second, trying to un-jam it.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Two! Flagstaff gets rattled by the fact there are still three zombies COMING. But Albuquerque doesn’t ever get rattled. He DITCHES the STEYR AUG and digs in his duffel bag. We take the ZOMBIES’ P.O.V. as they RUSH toward a GUY who kneeling with his back turned. They’re almost upon him wh he STANDS and TURNS, holding TWO HUGE .50 CALIBER DESERT EAGLE PISTOLS, palms facing the ground, like a GANGSTA. BOOM-BOOM-BOOM-BOOM-BOOM-BOOM-BOOM-BOOM! The zombies have nowhere to go but down.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Eleven! And... three! Albuquerque moves to the front corner of the truck, takes at both eleven and three, and fires in BOTH DIRECTIONS, o with EACH pistol. BOOM-BOOM-BOOM-BOOM! Two CLIPS fall. Two NEW clips go in. BOOM-BOOM-BOOM-BOOM! Zombies drop. But Flagstaff is ALARMED. There are a lot o ZOMBIES with a head start, headed for the BACK of the tru

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Nine! Six! Five! Basically, nine to five! Albuquerque finishes shooting, JAMS in new clips, and run the DENALI from front bumper to windshield to roof, past Flagstaff, JUMPING off the back. He LANDS with a THUD, boots on concrete. There are EIGHT zombies bearing down on him. What happens next is the stuff of legend: Albuquerque shi his weight from one foot to the other like a BOXER, and t starts fighting HAND to HAND... only he’s using the pisto as extensions of his fists, shooting at the MOMENT he delivers each PUNCH. In other words, it looks like Albuquerque is fighting in Rocky movie, but every punch carries with it the extra oo of a discharged .50 caliber BULLET. The zombies arrive ONE-BY-ONE. Boom! A right CROSS to the TEMPLE. Now vicious BODY-SHOTS to the stomach. BOOM! BOOM! BOOM! BOOM-BOOM! A one-two combination to the JAW. UPPERCUTS to the CHIN. BOOM! BOOM! More BODY-SHOTS. BOOM-BOOM-BOOM! Cypress Hill is still SLAMMING over the speakers. Zombies FLY and FLOP in every direction. The last ZOMBIE trips before he can get punched. So ALBUQUERQUE PUNCHES him on the GROUND. BOOM! BOOM! BOOM! By the end, Albuquerque is just venting RAGE. Flagstaff is SO ENTRANCED that he hasn’t remembered to ke looking out, specifically behind him. ALBUQUERQUE looks i Flagstaff’s direction, and his expression narrows:

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Twelve... Flagstaff SPINS around to see ONE ZOMBIE running right up HOOD of the SUV at him, and about FIFTEEN ZOMBIES about SEVENTY YARDS BEHIND. His expression is one of sheer TERR  95. Flagstaff FLINCHES and DUCKS, taking out the feet of the zombie, which TRIPS right over him, sliding to the back o the roof. It looks up... ...xvight into the BARREL of ALBUQUERQUE’s .50 CAL. BOOM! A SHELL-SHOCKED Flagstaff looks off the hood to where the oncoming zombies are no more than FIFTY YARDS AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Got a lighter? Flagstaff shakes off his shock long enough to register Albuquerque’s question. He digs into his pants pocket, produces a small ZIP-LOC BAG, fishes out a BIC LIGHTER, a tosses it to ALBUQUERQUE. Superimposed onscreen: A TITLE: 2. Zip-Loc Bags Albuquerque catches the lighter. He whips out his WALLET, flips out his VISA CARD, slides it through the GAS PUMP S chooses ‘87’ octane, and yanks out the forward-most NOZZL Then Albuquerque JUMPS onto the HOOD. He holds the lighte in front of the NOZZLE. He flicks on a FLAME, and clamps down the lever to start PUMPING GAS. Only one problem: NOTHING COMES OUT. Back on the pump, the little LCD screen reads, ‘Waiting f Approval.’ Flagstaff and Albuquerque share a look.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: How’s your credit?

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: (a little embarrassed) Not terrible. The sprinting ZOMBIES reach the SUV and START TO CLIMB ON THE HOOD. Back on the PUMP, there’s a BEEP, and the SCREEN reads, ‘Begin Fueling.’ At that INSTANT, a JET of FLAME SHOOTS OUT of the front o the NOZZLE, and ALBUQUERQUE is suddenly behind the greate FLAME THROWER EVER. Zombies clamber up the car, then peel away as they catch and COMBUST.  96. He SPRAYS the stream of flame LEFT and RIGHT, in long arc like he’s watering the lawn. Then he starts to wield it like that FIRE WHIP of the BAL in ‘Lord of the Rings.’ Then he starts using it like a gun, a shot here and there At long last, the final zombie falls in a burning heap. Flagstaff turns in a full circle. Not a zombie in sight. Anywhere. It's over. Cypress Hill’s song finishes playing with a flourish. ALBUQUERQUE lets out an ADRENALIZED PRIMAL VICTORY SCREAM Albuquerque strolls over and nonchalantly GASSES UP his Denali. Flagstaff and Albuquerque look at one another. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: It’s a pleasure watching you work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHACK! ALBUQUERQUE kicks open the front door of the MINI- MART. He and FLAGSTAFF each carry SHOTGUNS. They move around the store, searching for zombies, making sure they cover every nook and cranny.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: If you don’t mind, how’d you become such a, uh...

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: «..rock-star?

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: My Mom used to tell me: Don’t worry; someday you’1ll be good at something. When they’re satisfied that they’re alone, the two meet i the middle of the store, their BACKS to the HOSTESS RACK. Suddenly, they hear the sound of CRINKLING PLASTIC. What exactly is that noise, and WHERE is it coming from?  97. Albuquerque SHUSHES Flagstaff. The CRINKLING is coming fr right BEHIND them, and it’s getting LOUDER. Without wasting another moment, a JUMPY Flagstaff SPINS a opens fire MERCILESSLY with his SHOTGUN. THUMP! THUMP! THUMP! THUMP! Stuff CRASHES and SPLATTERS everywhere. Flagstaff stops shooting, breathing hard with fear. A RAT emerges from an open DORITO’S BAG on the floor, the scurries away. Albuquerque looks from the Dorito’s bag, t Flagstaff, to the now-DESTROYED HOSTESS RACK. Every TWINKIE BOX has been blasted into SMITHEREENS. The pair realizes Flagstaff’s mistake simultaneously. The only box that somehow got spared? SNO-BALLS.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Eat a Sno-Ball, I’1l kill you myself.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: Words can’t begin to express...

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: (wipes at his eye) No. Don’t. It’s too soon. The two bow their heads. Then:

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: You’1l want a moment alone. Flagstaff heads out the FRONT.

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Guard the door. I’m checking the back room. For survivors. (to himself) Golden, spongy, creamy survivors. Albuquerque is ALONE, doing the kind of thing Flagstaff l to warn against. He REACHES behind the counter... Is it possible that his arm is about to get CHOMPED ON by ravenous hidden zombie? The music SWELLS... Nope. Albuquerque snags some KEYS and walks BACK to the LOCKED STORE ROOM DOOR.  98. Albuquerque unlocks the door, then steps back and NUDGES open with his boot. It creaks aside ominously. Then... .+-CRASH! An impatient Albuquerque KICKS it open the rest the way. We almost have a HEART ATTACK. Next, Albuquerque uses the BARREL of his SHOTGUN to FLICK LIGHT SWITCH inside the door. We’re suddenly INSIDE the room, looking back out at ALBUQUERQUE in the open door. H lowers his shotgun, his expression one of complete SHOCK:

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Holy. Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLAGSTAFF is about twenty feet in front of the Mini-Mart, kneeling, carefully reloading his SHOTGUN with shells fro his trusty ZIP-LOC BAG. He HEARS the door of the Mini-Mart OPEN behind him. Footsteps approach. Flagstaff snaps the SHOTGUN closed an turns around to see... ... ALBUQUERQUE standing with his hands over his head, FL by WICHITA and STILLWATER, who have two SHOTGUNS at the ready. Flagstaff is STUNNED and secretly THRILLED to see girls.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: (to Stillwater, re: shotguns) No.

dialogues.speaker: STILLWATER
dialogues.text: Yes. Wichita holds her hand out in front of Albuquerque. Witho even questioning it this time, he pulls out the KEYS to t YUKON and places them on her palm. Armed with the keys, Wichita and Stillwater walk past Flagstaff on either side.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: (to Wichita) Noooo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pauses, smiles, and KISSES him on the CHEEK.

dialogues.speaker: WICHITA
dialogues.text: Yes... As the girls walk off, Flagstaff shakes his head, smirks, calls over their shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF
dialogues.text: You've just survived an attack by vicious, vomiting monsters! Where you gonna go?

dialogues.speaker: STILLWATER
dialogues.text: I’m going to Disneyland!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALBUQUERQUE and FLAGSTAFF stand by their duffel bag and roller suitcase, respectively. They stare helplessly as WICHITA and STILLWATER load the last of their own GEAR in the DENALI, shut the doors, and PULL AWAY. Deja Vu all ov again! Albuquerque and Flagstaff watch as their new nemeses literally drive off into the SUNSET.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This land is your land. This land is my land. This land is Zombieland. Full of death and disappointment. But never despair. ‘Cause when life gives you flesh-eating monsters... Suddenly, when the DENALI is forty yards away, its BRAKE LIGHTS come on, and it STOPS. The passenger door OPENS. Stillwater gets out, cocks her arm like Tom Brady, and TH a small pellet-shaped object at Albuquerque, in a high AR A PERFECT STRIKE. Albuquerque makes a one-handed CATCH an LOOKS to see what he’s holding: A TWINKIE.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: .---sometimes a little hope is all you need. Stillwater climbs into the Escalade, and it drives off. Albuquerque unwraps his Twinkie, smells it adoringly, and takes a BITE. Flagstaff watches, staring into the sunset.

dialogues.speaker: FLAGSTAFF, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That face? That's me making plans to go ride the Matterhorn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the meantime, remember, cardio, seatbelts, and - this has nothing to do with anything - but a little sunscreen never hurt anyone. I'm Flagstaff, Arizona, from Zombieland, saying... goodnight. FADE TO BLACK. The music over the END CREDITS is ‘THIS LAND IS YOUR LAND sung not by Woody Guthrie, but by the MORMON TABERNACLE CHOIR.
